ClusterPairModeMode.title:
- Default: Default pairing mode
 - DisasterRecovery: Paired for DisasterRecovery

LabelSelectorRequirementOperator.description:
- In: In means the value for 'key' should be in one of the given value(s)
 - NotIn: NotIn means the value for 'key' should NOT be in one of the given value(s)
 - Exists: Exists means the 'key' should just exist regardless of the value
 - DoesNotExist: DoesNotExist means the 'key' should NOT exist
 - Gt: Gt means the 'key' should be greater than the value(s)
 - Lt: Lt means the 'key' should be less than the value(s)
LabelSelectorRequirementOperator.title: This defines operator types used in a label matching rule

collaborators.description:
Collaborator access to resource gives access to other user.
Must be the username (unique id) set in the authorization token.
The owner or the administrator can set this value. Possible values are:
1. no collaborators: Means no users are given access.
2. `["*"]`: All users are allowed.
3. `["username1", "username2"]`: Only certain usernames are allowed. In this example only
_username1_ and _username2_ are allowed.

groups.description:
Group access to resource which must match the group set in the
authorization token.
Can be set by the owner or the system administrator only.
Possible values are:
1. no groups: Means no groups are given access.
2. `["*"]`: All groups are allowed.
3. `["group1", "group2"]`: Only certain groups are allowed. In this example only
_group1_ and _group2_ are allowed.

OwnershipAccessType.description:
Access types can be set by owner to have different levels of access to
a resource.

It is up to the resource to interpret what the types mean and are
used for.

 - Read: Read access only and cannot affect the resource.
 - Write: Write access and can affect the resource.
This type automatically provides Read access also.
 - Admin: Administrator access.
This type automatically provides Read and Write access also.

VolumeSpecPolicyPolicyOp.description:
- Equal: Policy will make sure the value must be equal
 - Minimum: Policy will make sure the requested value must be greater than or equal
 - Maximum: Policy will make sure the requested value must be less than or equal
VolumeSpecPolicyPolicyOp.title: This defines an operator for the policy comparisons

count.description: Count of such alerts raised so far.

first_seen.description: Timestamp when such alert was raised the very first time.

ttl.title: Time-to-live in seconds for this Alert

unique_tag.title: UniqueTag helps identify a unique alert for a given resouce

apiAlert.title: Alert is a structure that represents an alert object

apiAttachState.title:
- ATTACH_STATE_EXTERNAL: Attached and available externally
 - ATTACH_STATE_INTERNAL: Attached but only available internally

apiCapacityUsageInfo.description:
Provides details on exclusive and shared storage used by
snapshot/volume specifically for copy-on-write(COW) snapshots. Deletion
of snapshots and overwirte of volume will affect the exclusive storage
used by the other dependent snaps and parent volume.

exclusive_bytes.description:
Storage consumed exclusively by this single snapshot. Deletion of this
snapshot may increase the free storage available by this amount.

shared_bytes.title: Storage consumed by this snapshot that is shared with parent and children

task_id.title: The id of the task to cancel

bytes_done.title: BytesDone is the number of bytes already transferred

bytes_total.title: BytesTotal is the number of bytes being transferred

cloudbackup_id.title: ID of the cloudbackup used for the migration

cluster_id.title: ID of the cluster where the volume is being migrated

error_reason.title: Contains the reason for the migration error

eta_seconds.title: ETASeconds the time duration in seconds for cloud migration completion

last_update.title: Last time the status was updated

local_volume_id.title: ID of the volume on the local cluster

local_volume_name.title: Name of the volume on the local cluster

remote_volume_id.title: ID of the volume on the remote cluster

task_id.title: Task id associated with this migration

info.title: Map of cluster id to the status of volumes being migrated

apiCloudMigrateStatusResponse.title: Response with a status of the cloud migration operations

remote_cluster_token.title: Token used to authenticate with the remote cluster

set_default.title: Set the new pair as the default

apiClusterPairGetResponse.title: Reponse to get a cluster pair

endpoint.title: The endpoint used for creating the pair

options.title:
Key/value pair of options associated with the cluster
Opaque to openstorage and interpreted by the drivers

secure.title: Flag used to determine if communication is over a secure channel

apiClusterPairTokenGetResponse.title: Response to get the cluster token

default_id.title: ID of the default cluster pair

pairs.title: Pairs Info about the cluster pairs

apiEnforcementType.description:
- required: This specifies that the rule is required and must be strictly enforced
 - preferred: This specifies that the rule is preferred and can be best effort
apiEnforcementType.title: Defines the types of enforcement on the given rules

apiExportProtocol.description:
ExportProtocol defines how the device is exported..

 - INVALID: Invalid uninitialized value
 - PXD: PXD the volume is exported over Portworx block interace.
 - ISCSI: ISCSI the volume is exported over ISCSI.
 - NFS: NFS the volume is exported over NFS.
 - CUSTOM: Custom the volume is exported over custom interace.

apiExportSpec.description: ExportSpec defines how the volume is exported..

apiGroup.description:
Group represents VolumeGroup / namespace
All volumes in the same group share this object.

id.description: Id common identifier across volumes that have the same group.

apiHardwareType.title:
- UnknownMachine: When we do not know the machine type alsp the default
 - VirtualMachine: when we are running on virtual machine
 - BareMetalMachine: when we are running on physical hardware

apiIoStrategy.description: IoStrategy defines how I/O should be performed to backing storage media.

early_ack.description: EarlyAck enables acks for async I/O at the source.

apiLabelSelectorRequirement.description:
LabelSelectorRequirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that
relates the key and values.

key.description: Key is the label key that the selector applies to.

values.description:
Values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn,
the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist,
the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic
merge patch.

action.title: Action being taken on this objectstore

current_endpoint.title: CurrentEndpoint on which objectstore server is accessible

volume_id.title: VolumeID of volume used by object store

apiObjectstoreInfo.title: ObjectstoreInfo is a structure that has current objectstore info

apiOwnership.description:
Ownership information for resource.
Administrators are users who belong to the group `*`, meaning, every group.

owner.description:
Username of owner.

The storage system uses the username taken from the security authorization
token and is saved on this field. Only users with system administration
can edit this value.

affected_replicas.title:
AffectedReplicas defines the number of volume replicas affected by this rule. If not provided,
rule would affect all replicas
(optional)

match_expressions.description: MatchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

topology_key.title:
TopologyKey key for the matching all segments of the cluster topology with the same key
e.g If the key is failure-domain.beta.kubernetes.io/zone, this should match all nodes with
the same value for this key (i.e in the same zone)

weight.title:
Weight defines the weight of the rule which allows to break the tie with other matching rules. A rule with
higher weight wins over a rule with lower weight.
(optional)

pool_uuids.title: Unique IDs of the storage pools for this replica set

apiReplicaSet.title:
ReplicaSet set of machine IDs (nodes) to which part of this volume is erasure
coded - for clustered storage arrays

apiRuntimeStateMap.description:
RuntimeStateMap is a list of name value mapping of driver specific runtime
information.

apiSdkAlertsAlertTypeQuery.description:
SdkAlertsAlertTypeQuery queries for alerts using alert type
and it requires that resource type be provided as well.

alert_type.description: Alert type used to build query.

apiSdkAlertsCountSpan.description: SdkAlertsCountSpan to store count range information.

max_count.description: Max count of such alerts raised so far.

min_count.description: Min count of such alerts raised so far.

apiSdkAlertsDeleteRequest.description: SdkAlertsDeleteRequest is a request message to delete alerts.

queries.description:
It takes a list of queries to find matching alerts.
Matching alerts are deleted.

apiSdkAlertsEnumerateWithFiltersRequest.description: SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest is a request message to enumerate alerts.

queries.description:
It is a list of queries to find matching alerts.
Output of each of these queries is added to a global pool
and returned as output of an RPC call.
In that sense alerts are fetched if they match any of the
queries.

apiSdkAlertsEnumerateWithFiltersResponse.description: SdkAlertsEnumerateResponse is a list of alerts.

alerts.description: Response contains a list of alerts.

apiSdkAlertsOption.description: SdkAlertsOption contains options for filtering alerts.

apiSdkAlertsQuery.description:
SdkAlertsQuery is one of the query types and a list of options.
Each query object is one of the three query types and a list of
options.

opts.description: Opts is a list of options associated with one of the queries.

apiSdkAlertsResourceIdQuery.description:
SdkAlertsResourceIdQuery queries for alerts using resource id
and it requires that both alert type and resource type be provided
as well.

alert_type.description: Alert type used to build query.

resource_id.description: Resource ID used to build query.

apiSdkAlertsResourceTypeQuery.description: SdkAlertsResourceTypeQuery queries for alerts using only resource id.

apiSdkAlertsTimeSpan.description: SdkAlertsTimeSpan to store time window information.

FullBackupFrequency indicates number of incremental backup after whcih
a fullbackup must be created. This is to override the default value for
manual/user triggerred backups and not applicable for scheduled backups
Value of 0 retains the default behavior.

apiSdkCloudBackupEnumerateWithFiltersReq.description:
* For a specific volume in current cluster: Set `src_volume_id` to your desired volume id
and do not provide `cluster_id` and `all`.
* For a specific volume in a specific cluster: Set `src_volume_id` to your desired volume id
and specify `cluster_id`.
* For a specific volume in all clusters: Set `src_volume_id` to your desired volume id
and set `all` to true, do not provide `cluster_id`.
* For all volumes in current cluster: do not provide `cluster_id`, `volume_id` and `all`.
* For all volumes in a specific cluster: Set `cluster_id` to your desired cluster id
and do not provide `volume_id` and `all`.
* For all volumes in all clusters: Set `all` to true do not provide `volume_id` and `cluster_id`.

all.description: (optional) All indicates if the request should show cloud backups for all clusters or the current cluster.

cloud_backup_id.title:
If one wants to enumerate known backup, set this field to the backup ID
naming format :clusteruuidORbicketname/srcVolId-snapId(-incr)

cluster_id.title: (optional) Cluster id specifies the cluster for the request

continuation_token.description:

max_backups.title: (optional) if caller wished to limit number of backups returned by enumerate

metadata_filter.title: (optional) Enumerates backups that have tags of this type

src_volume_id.description: (optional) Source id of the volume for the request.

state change is being requested

apiSdkRule.description:
SdkRule is the message used to construct custom roles in the OpenStorage SDK.

### Format
The following shows the supported format for SdkRule:

* Services: Is the gRPC service name in `OpenStorage<service name>` in lowercase
* Apis: Is the API name in the service in lowercase

Values can also be set to `*`, or start or end with `*` to allow multiple matches in services or apis.

### Examples

* Allow any call:

```yaml
SdkRule:
  - Services: ["*"]
    Apis: ["*"]
```

* Allow only cluster operations:

```yaml
SdkRule:
  - services: ["cluster"]
    apis: ["*"]
```

* Allow inspection of any object and listings of only volumes

```yaml
SdkRule:
  - Services: ["volumes"]
    Apis: ["*enumerate*"]
  - Services: ["*"]
    Apis: ["inspect*"]
```

apis.title: The API name in the service in lowercase

services.title: The gRPC service name in `OpenStorage<service name>` in lowercase

apiSdkSchedulePolicyEnumerateResponse.title: Defines a schedule policy enumerate response

apiSdkSchedulePolicyInspectResponse.title: Defines a schedule policy inspection response

seconds.title: Specify the number of seconds between intervals

apiSdkSchedulePolicyUpdateRequest.title: Define a request to update a schedule policy

apiSdkServiceCapability.title: Defines a capability of he cluster

allow_update.title:
If set a volume can be updated without storage Policy
restriction, otherwise volume update will be followed as per storage policy
specification

force.title:
Force if set to true volume specs will be overwritten, otherwise
volume creation will fail if the volume specifications are not inline with storage policy

apiSdkStoragePolicy.title:
A SdkStoragePolicy represents minimum set of volume specs to be
follow while creating volumes.
If storage policy is set default in OpenStoragePolicy service, VolumeSpecPolicy will be
used before creating volume to validate volume specs or ensure minimum volume creation
rules followed

apiSdkVersion.description:
SDK version in Major.Minor.Patch format. The goal of this
message is to provide clients a method to determine the SDK
version run by an SDK server.

version.description:
String representation of the SDK version. Must be
in `major.minor.patch` format.

secret_context.description:
It indicates the additional context which could be used to retrieve the secret.
In case of Kubernetes, this is the namespace in which the secret is created.

secret_key.title: In case of Kubernetes, this will be the key stored in the Kubernetes secret

secret_name.title:
Indicates the name of the secret stored in a secret store
In case of Hashicorp's Vault, it will be the key from the key-value pair stored in its kv backend.
In case of Kubernetes secret, it is the name of the secret object itself

driver_options.description:
The following options are private to the driver plugin running the
OpenStorage SDK. Contact your driver developer for any special
values that need to be provided here.

apiSdkVolumeCapacityUsageResponse.title: Defines response containing volume/snapshot capacity usage details

name.description: Unique name of the volume. This will be used for idempotency.

parent_id.description: Parent volume id or snapshot id will create a new volume as a clone of the parent.

Defines a request to create a volume. Use OpenStorageVolume.Update()
to update any labels on the volume.

labels.title: Labels to apply to the volume

name.description: Unique name of the volume. This will be used for idempotency.

apiSdkVolumeCreateResponse.title: Defines a response to the creation of a volume

force.title: Forcefully detach device from the kernel

redirect.title: redirect the request to the attached node

The following options are private to the driver plugin running the
OpenStorage SDK. Contact your driver developer for any special
values that need to be provided here.

apiSdkVolumeEnumerateResponse.title: Defines the response when listing volumes

driver_options.description:
The following options are private to the driver plugin running the
OpenStorage SDK. Contact your driver developer for any special
values that need to be provided here.

mount_path.description: Mount path for mounting the volume.

volume_id.title: Id of volume to take the snapshot from

apiSdkVolumeStatsResponse.title: Defines a response containing drive statistics

delete_mount_path.title: Delete the mount path on the node after unmounting

no_delay_before_deleting_mount_path.description:
Do not wait for a delay before deleting path.
Normally a storage driver may delay before deleting the mount path,
which may be necessary to reduce the risk of race conditions. This
choice will remove that delay. This value is only usable when
`delete_mount_path` is set.

driver_options.description:
The following options are private to the driver plugin running the
OpenStorage SDK. Contact your driver developer for any special
values that need to be provided here.

apiSdkVolumeUnmountRequest.title: Defines a request to unmount a volume on the node receiving this request

labels.description:
Change label values. Some of these values may not be able to be changed.
New labels will be added to the current volume labels. To delete a label, set the
value of the label to an empty string.

volume_id.title: Id of the volume to update

apiSdkVolumeUpdateRequest.title: This request is used to adjust or set new values in the volume

apiSource.description:
Source is a structure that can be given to a volume
to seed the volume with data.

parent.description: A volume id, if specified will create a clone of the parent.

seed.title:
Seed will seed the volume from the specified URI
Any additional config for the source comes from the labels in the spec

interval_ms.title: Interval in ms during which stats were collected

read_ms.title: Time spent in reads in ms

write_ms.title: Time spent in writes in ms

apiStats.title: Stats is a structure that represents last collected stats for a volume

apiStorageCluster.title: StorageCluster represents the state and information about the cluster

apiStorageMedium.title:
- STORAGE_MEDIUM_MAGNETIC: Magnetic spinning disk.
 - STORAGE_MEDIUM_SSD: SSD disk
 - STORAGE_MEDIUM_NVME: NVME disk

disks.title: List of disks on the node

node_labels.title: User defined labels for the node

pools.title: List of storage pools this node supports

scheduler_node_name.description:
SchedulerNodeName is name of the node in scheduler context. It can be
empty if unable to get the name from the scheduler.

apiStorageNode.title: StorageNode describes the state of the node

ID.title: Deprecated! Use `uuid` instead. ID pool ID

labels.title: Labels is a list of user defined name-value pairs

uuid.title: UUID is the unique identifier for a storage pool

apiStoragePool.title: StoragePool groups different storage devices based on their CosType

msg.title: Msg is a user friendly message for the operation

params.title: Params for the parameters for the operation

apiStoragePoolOperation.title: StoragePoolOperation defines an operation being performed on a storage pool

apiStorageResource.description: StorageResource groups properties of a storage device.

last_scan.description: Timestamp of last time this device was scanned.

online.description: True if this device is online.

path.description: Path device path for this storage resource.

rotation_speed.description: True if this device is rotational.

details.title: Extra information provided by the storage system

apiStorageVersion.title: Version information about the storage system

apiVolume.description: Volume represents an abstract storage volume.

attach_info.description: AttachInfo is a list of name value mappings that provides attach information.

attach_path.description: AttachPath is the mounted path in the host namespace.

attach_time.description: AttachTime time this device was last attached externally.

attached_on.description: AttachedOn is the node instance identifier for clustered systems.

detach_time.description: DetachTime time this device was detached.

device_path.description: DevicePath is the device exported by block device implementations.

error.description: Error is the Last recorded error.

fs_resize_required.description: FsResizeRequired if an FS resize is required on the volume.

last_scan.description: LastScan is the time when an integrity check was run.

readonly.description: Readonly is true if this volume is to be mounted with readonly access.

replica_sets.description: ReplicatSets storage for this volumefor clustered storage arrays.

runtime_state.description:
RuntimeState is a lst of name value mapping of driver specific runtime
information.

secure_device_path.description: SecureDevicePath is the device path for an encrypted volume.

usage.description: Usage is bytes consumed by this volume.

volume_consumers.title: VolumeConsumers are entities that consume this volume

name.title: Name is the name of the volume consumer

namespace.title: Namespace is the namespace of the volume consumer

node_id.description:
NodeID is the identifier of the node on which the consumer is running. This
identifier would be from the perspective of the container runtime or
orchestrator under which the volume consumer resides. For example, NodeID
 can be name of a minion in Kubernetes.

owner_name.title: OwnerName is the name of the entity who owns this volume consumer

owner_type.description:
OwnerType is the type of the entity who owns this volume consumer. The type would
be from the perspective of the container runtime or the orchestrator under which
the volume consumer resides. For e.g OwnerType can be a Deployment in Kubernetes.

type.title: Type is the type of the consumer. E.g a Kubernetes pod

apiVolumeConsumer.title:
VolumeConsumer identifies a consumer for a Volume. An example of a VolumeConsumer
would be a Pod in Kubernetes who has mounted the PersistentVolumeClaim for the
Volume

deep.description:
Deep inspection is used to collect more information about
the volume. Setting this value may delay the request.

apiVolumeLocator.description:
VolumeLocator is a structure that is attached to a volume
and is used to carry opaque metadata.

volume_labels.title: A set of name-value pairs that acts as search filters

match_expressions.description: MatchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

topology_key.title:
TopologyKey key for the matching all segments of the cluster topology with the same key
e.g If the key is failure-domain.beta.kubernetes.io/zone, this should match all nodes with
the same value for this key (i.e in the same zone)

weight.title:
Weight defines the weight of the rule which allows to break the tie with other matching rules. A rule with
higher weight wins over a rule with lower weight.
(optional)

apiVolumePlacementStrategy.description:
VolumePlacementStrategy defines a strategy for placing volumes in the cluster which will be a series of rules
All the rules specified will be applied for volume placement.
Rules that have enforcement as "required" are strictly enforced while "preferred" are best effort.
In situations, where 2 or more rules conflict, the weight of the rules will dictate which wins.

replica_affinity.title: ReplicaAffinity defines affinity rules between replicas within a volume

replica_anti_affinity.title: ReplicaAntiAffinity defines anti-affinity rules between replicas within a volume

volume_affinity.title: VolumeAffinity defines affinity rules between volumes

volume_anti_affinity.title: VolumeAntiAffinity defines anti-affinity rules between volumes

apiVolumeSpec.description: VolumeSpec has the properties needed to create a volume.

aggregation_level.description: Aggregation level Specifies the number of parts the volume can be aggregated from.

cascaded.description: Cascaded is true if this volume can be populated on any node from an external source.

compressed.description: Compressed is true if this volume is to be compressed.

dedupe.description: Dedupe specifies if the volume data is to be de-duplicated.

encrypted.description: Encrypted is true if this volume will be cryptographically secured.

force_unsupported_fs_type.description:
Use to force a file system type which is not recommended.
The driver may still refuse to use the file system type.

group_enforced.description: GroupEnforced is true if consistency group creation is enforced.

ha_level.description: HaLevel specifies the number of copies of data.

journal.description: Journal is true if data for the volume goes into the journal.

nodiscard.description:
Nodiscard specifies if the volume will be mounted with discard support disabled.
i.e. FS will not release allocated blocks back to the backing storage pool.

queue_depth.title: QueueDepth defines the desired block device queue depth

shared.description: Shared is true if this volume can be concurrently accessed by multiple users.

sharedv4.description: Sharedv4 is true if this volume can be accessed via sharedv4.

size.title: Size specifies the thin provisioned volume size in bytes

snapshot_interval.title: SnapshotInterval in minutes, set to 0 to disable snapshots

snapshot_schedule.description: SnapshotSchedule a well known string that specifies when snapshots should be taken.

sticky.description: Sticky volumes cannot be deleted until the flag is removed.

storage_policy.title: StoragePolicy if applied/specified while creating volume

volume_labels.title: (deprecated, do not use) VolumeLabels configuration labels

apiVolumeSpecPolicy.title: VolumeSpecPolicy provides a method to set volume storage policy

apiVolumeSpecUpdate.title: VolumeSpecUpdate provides a method to set any of the VolumeSpec of an existing volume

apiVolumeState.description:
VolumeState represents the state of a volume.

 - VOLUME_STATE_PENDING: Volume is transitioning to new state
 - VOLUME_STATE_AVAILABLE: Volume is ready to be assigned to a container
 - VOLUME_STATE_ATTACHED: Volume is attached to container
 - VOLUME_STATE_DETACHED: Volume is detached but associated with a container
 - VOLUME_STATE_DETATCHING: Volume detach is in progress
 - VOLUME_STATE_ERROR: Volume is in error state
 - VOLUME_STATE_DELETED: Volume is deleted, it will remain in this state
while resources are asynchronously reclaimed
 - VOLUME_STATE_TRY_DETACHING: Volume is trying to be detached
 - VOLUME_STATE_RESTORE: Volume is undergoing restore

apiVolumeStatus.description:
VolumeStatus represents a health status for a volume.

 - VOLUME_STATUS_NOT_PRESENT: Volume is not present
 - VOLUME_STATUS_UP: Volume is healthy
 - VOLUME_STATUS_DOWN: Volume is in fail mode
 - VOLUME_STATUS_DEGRADED: Volume is up but with degraded performance
In a RAID group, this may indicate a problem with one or more drives

openstorageapiStatus.title: - STATUS_MAX: Add statuses before MAX and update the number for MAX

post.description:
#### Delete
Delete allows 3 different types of queries as defined below:

* Query that takes only resource type as input
* Query that takes resource type and alert type as input and
* Query that takes resource id, alert type and resource type as input.

#### Input
SdkAlertsDeleteRequest takes a list of such queries and all alerts
that match at least one of the queries are deleted.
post.summary: Delete alerts

post.description:
EnumerateWithFilters allows 3 different types of queries as defined below:

* Query that takes only resource type as input
* Query that takes resource type and alert type as input and
* Query that takes resource id, alert type and resource type as input.

#### Input
SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest takes a list of such queries and the returned
output is a collective ouput from each of these queries. In that sense,
the filtering of these queries has a behavior of OR operation.
Each query also has a list of optional options. These options allow
narrowing down the scope of alerts search. These options have a
behavior of an AND operation.

#### Examples
To search by a resource type in a given time window would require
initializing SdkAlertsResourceTypeQuery query and pass in
SdkAlertsTimeSpan option into SdkAlertsQuery struct and finally
packing any other such queries into SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest object.
Alternatively, to search by both resource type and alert type, use
SdkAlertsAlertTypeQuery as query builder.
Finally to search all alerts of a given resource type and some
alerts of another resource type but with specific alert type,
use two queries, first initialized with SdkAlertsResourceTypeQuery
and second initialized with SdkAlertsAlertTypeQuery and both
eventually packed as list in SdkAlertsEnumerateRequest.
post.summary: Allows querying alerts.

Creates a backup request for a specified volume. Use
OpenStorageCloudBackup.Status() to get the current status of the
backup request.

parameters.description: Credential id is the credential for cloud to be used for the request.
parameters.name: credential_id

parameters.description:
Force Delete cloudbackup even if there are dependencies. This may be
needed if the backup is an incremental backup and subsequent backups
depend on this backup specified by `backup_id`.
parameters.name: force

delete.summary:
Deletes a backup stored in the cloud. If the backup is an incremental
backup and other backups are dependent on it, it will not be able to be deleted.

post.summary: Catalog returns a list of the contents in the backup
DeleteAll deletes all the backups in the cloud for the specified volume.
Return a list of backups for the specified volume

post.description: This will only backup volumes which the user has read_access to.
post.summary:
Creates a group backup request for a specified group. Use
OpenStorageCloudBackup.Status() to get the current status of the
backup request.

get.summary: History returns a list of backups for a specified volume

post.summary:
Restore creates a new volume from a backup id. The newly created volume
has an ha_level (number of replicas) of only 1. To increase the number of
replicas, use OpenStorageVolume.Set() to change the ha_level.

get.summary: Enumerate cloud backup schedules

post.summary: Create cloud backup schedule
StateChange can be used to stop, pause, and restart a backup
Status returns the status of any cloud backups of a volume

get.summary: Enumerate returns names of all the cluster domains in the cluster

post.summary:
Activates a cluster domain in the cluster.
All the nodes which are part of an active cluster domain
will participate in cluster quorum calculation

Deactivates a cluster domain in the cluster.
All the nodes which are part of a deactivated cluster domain.
will not participate in cluster quorum calculation

get.summary:
Inspect returns information about a cluster domain and a
status indicating whether the cluster domain is active
Enumerate returns list of cluster pairs

post.summary: Creates Pair with a remote cluster and returns details about the remote cluster

get.summary: Inspect information about a cluster pair
GetToken returns a auth token

post.summary: ResetToken returns a auth token

get.summary: InspectCurrent returns information about the current cluster
Enumerate returns a list of credential ids

post.summary:
Create is used to submit cloud credentials. It will return an
id of the credentials once they are verified to work.

get.summary: Inspect returns the information about a credential, but does not return the secret key.
Validate is used to validate credentials

Capabilities returns the supported services by the cluster.
This allows SDK implementations to advertise their supported
services as the API matures. With this information, clients
can determine supported services from storage clusters at
different versions.
Version returns version information about the system.

post.summary: Attach attaches device to the host that the client is communicating with.
Detaches a the volume from the host
Mount mounts an attached volume in the host that the client is communicating with
Unmount unmounts a mounted volume in the host that the client is communicating with

get.summary: Enumerate returns the ids of all the nodes in the current cluster
EnumerateWithFilters returns all the nodes in the current cluster
Inspect returns information about the specified node

InspectCurrent returns information about the storage node
where the client is currently connected to.

delete.summary: Delete destroys the object store endpoint on the volume

put.summary:
Updates provided objectstore status.
This call can be used to stop and start the server while maintaining the same
object storage id.

get.summary: List all roles

post.summary: Create a role for users in the system

get.summary: Get information about a role

Create creates a new snapshot schedule. They can be setup daily,
weekly, or monthly.

get.summary: Inspect returns information about a specified schedule
Enumerate returns a list of storage policies

DefaultInspect return default storage policy if any, otherwise
empty response

Release specified storage policy constraint for volume
creation

parameters.description: Task id for which to return status.
parameters.name: request.task_id

get.summary: Inspect the status of migration operation

get.summary: Enumerate returns a list of volume ids

post.summary: Create creates a volume according to the specification provided
Clone creates a new writable volume cloned from an existing volume
Enumerate returns a list of volume ids that match the labels if any are provided.

parameters.description:
Deep inspection is used to collect more information about
the volume. Setting this value may delay the request.
parameters.name: options.deep

get.summary: Inspect returns information about a volume

post.summary:
Returns information for a list of volumes that match a filter.
This call is a helper function like calling
`OpenStorageVolume.EnumerateWithFilters` then having it
return the contents of each of those volumes
`OpenStorageVolume.Inspect()`. Take care in using this call
when requesting large number of volumes because it will
block until it has all the information requested before
returning.

Sets the snapshot schedules. This information is saved in the VolumeSpec.snapshot_schedule
as `policy=<name>,...`. This function will overwrite any policy values
in the volume. To delete the policies in the volume send no policies.

parameters.description: Get the snapshots for this volume id.
parameters.name: volume_id

get.summary: SnapshotEnumerate returns a list of snapshots for a specific volume

post.summary:
SnapshotCreate creates a snapshot of a volume. This creates an immutable (read-only),
point-in-time snapshot of a volume. To create a new writable volume from
a snapshot, please use OpenStorageVolume.Clone().
SnapshotRestore restores a volume to a specified snapshot

SnapshotEnumerate returns a list of snapshots.
To filter all the snapshots for a specific volume which may no longer exist,
specifiy a volume id.
Labels can also be used to filter the snapshot list.
If neither are provided all snapshots will be returned.

parameters.description:
When set to false the stats are in /proc/diskstats style stats.
When set to true the stats are stats for a specific duration.
parameters.name: not_cumulative

get.summary: Stats returns the statistics for the requested volume

get.description:
Requires access AccessType.Read of volume

##### Error codes:

* codes.Aborted : Command was aborted and only total_bytes field is valid
* code.Unimmplemented : Command is not suported this kernel.Only total_bytes
field is valid;
get.summary: CapacityUsage returns volume/snapshot's capacity usage details

put.summary:
Update provides a method for manipulating the specification and attributes of a volume.
Set can be used to resize a volume, update labels, change replica count, and much more.
